title: hopefully Riot see this.
body:
so this will probably sound salty and stupid and you's have probably heard it 5 million times before.
however i'm not a fan of the 5.2 patch spoilers (apart from the potential Zed touch)
but by removing DFG (Deathfire Grasp) you are literally removing so many champions from the game as well as stopping so many AP assassins and just making them simple casters (Ahri, whatever was left of LB and many others)
while it's cool and gets people to use different items i don't think you should take it out of the game.

as said a lil up top. i feel that the only thing you's need to do to Zed is remove the fact he can return to his R shadow.
i think that it's smarter than changing any stats or other abilities. he can dump damage on you, under tower and still get away before you can react.
maybe make his ult a longer cooldown? (i'd literally rather see Shen ult as often he does, but whatever)

i feel that you make all the character changes with mostly the pro scene and lcs in mind. the changes don't ever do any "balancing" for the players that aren't there. (i'm probably 99% wrong there and i'm willing to accept that)

-hopefully you see this, regards Asai Fubuki (was known as Winter Demon)

replies.body: The removal of dfg can mean exciting new items (to replace it) and new builds for the assassins. The assassin mages are still going to be relevant and viable and hella strong, it will just take more skill to used them.

i can understand this, but it really is sticking a sharp stick in the AP eye :p
if they reveal new items that'd be cool and would render my argument invalid and i would be fine with that.

the only thing being removed here are bads just like you
get rekt and leave pls no one will miss u
I think people rather have people like him around, than people like you.

thank you, while i expected comments like this i respect yours the most here! (:

as for the guy that has the comment we are both replying to.
i really don't see why you have to bring that kind of attitude directly onto the Riot board.
i hope they do something about your negativity.
Zed takes awhile to truly master, why would you ruin his r mechanic?

no, while i'll give you that he's not easy to play.
he's not exactly hard to learn. i'm not saying this to target Zed mains, it was a suggestion because the only problem i ever see anyone ever have with him, be it i'm on jungle or in top or bot or even facing him myself as the midlaner.
the only thing that no one i've seen play (this goes for when he's on my team)
is the fact no one can return a kill. going 1for1 in lane is awesome, but when you never get that chance it makes the people feel like %%%%
